text: hi everyone is Helen here guess what I'm
in Vietnam it's been almost 10 years in
a lot of time I spent my Christmas in
Vietnam so I'm really excited to be here
this year believe it or not Christmas in
order public holiday in Vietnam because
the very small percentage of the
populations are Christians so students
still have to go to schools and workers
do have to go to work on Christmas days
just like any other days but we still
consider Christmas a huge event and
celebrated in our unique ways on
Christmas Eve and many evenings before
Christmas people in big cities
especially young people go to the city
center to enjoy the sparkling Christmas
decoration and lights in bits shopping
centers hotels or Catholic villages are
what we called sundown the streets are
always mega claret and noisy
[Music]
unlike in Western countries where
Christmas is the time for family reunion
and everyone must gather at home to
enjoy a delicious meal together
Christmas in Vietnam on the other hand
is an open occasion together with
friends and loved ones everyone puts on
their favorite to feste outfits go to
the city centers and take pictures with
the Christmas trees and decorations
lovers give each other presents and have
fun together it could be at home as
restaurants or on the streets there's
actually no traditional food that we eat
on this occasion some people follow
Western traditions and make a roasted
chicken and roasted pork or u-lock while
others just enjoy any dishes that they
feel like to basically Christmas is just
an occasion to celebrate and it's not
really a tradition a Vietnam so I just
want to shortly drop by to share with
you the Christmas atmosphere in Vietnam
to say Happy Holidays to are a few
Merry Christmas and Happy New Year thank
you for watching
[Music]
